div.data-react-data-bundle: {"notifications":[{"id":7303,"message":"-\u25d8\u25d8\u25d8- School resumes Monday, April 6th at 8 am through Distance Learning. Students please check into your Google Classrooms for instructions. -\u25d8\u25d8\u25d8- \r\n\r\nOut of an abundance of caution, and in consultation with local public health officials, Julian Union High School campus will be closed in order to curb the potential transmission of the coronavirus (COVID-19). School campus will remain closed until we can safely reopen. All activities and scheduled meetings are cancelled, including sports. JHS students will be provided distance learning starting on April 6th. All teachers will be in contact with their students.","type":"overlay"}]}

div.aria-label: For aesthetics only

div.div:
School resumes on Monday April 6th at 8 am via Distance Learning. All students are required to follow their teacher's instructions for connecting to class meetings.
Distance Learning Schedule:
Mon/Wed are ODD days. Tue/Thurs are EVEN days.
Periods 1│2 = 8:00-9:00 am
Periods 3│4 = 9:15-10:15 am
Periods 5│6 = 10:30-11:30 am.
Mon-Thurs afternoons and Fridays, teachers will be hosting tutorial sessions and office hours for those students that need assistance. Students will contact the teacher directly for their tutorial schedule.
Children's lunches will be available to pick-up during the school closure.
► Anyone ages 2-18 can pick up a free lunch at these locations, Monday-Friday beginning 3/17/2020.
• High School parking lot 11:30 - 12:00
• Shelter Valley community center 11:30 - 12:00
• Mesa Grande Old Dairy bus stop 11:30 - 12:00
• Butterfield Ranch bus stop 12:00 - 12:15
► Students don't need to sign for it, they just need to pick it up.

div.aria-label: Homecoming King & Queen 2019 crowned, on the football field
Homecoming Court 2019 presented at the Homecoming Football game half-time.
Girls' soccer team running for the goal.
Robot built by the Julian High Robotics Team preparing to lift a block.
Homecoming Parade on Main Street in Julian, CA.
Cheerleaders of 2019, cheering on the sidelines
Associated Student Body representatives of 2019 posing for a picture.
Students getting to know one another during Rachel's Challenge event.
SAL and American Legion Color Guard at Homecoming 2018
Dr. Hefflin awarded Certificate of Appreciation for her work in Social Justice, Equity, and Access for All Students
Girls' volleyball players diving for the ball.
Student actors jumping for joy at the end of 31st of June
FFA members pose for a photo before the Opening/Closing Competition
Julian High cooking club members show off their posters.
Students enjoying the Rachel's Challenge Event.
National Anthem being sung at the winter sports' Senior Night celebration.

div.aria-label: For aesthetics only

div.div:
Dear Parents/Guardians,
The Impact Aid Survey is something that we send out every year - and, although it asks for a few specifics, the school does get a substantial amount of money for each qualifying survey filled out and turned in! Please print and complete the survey below and have your student return it to the High School Office. Thank you!

a.title: JUHSD ONLINE REGISTRATION BEGINS JULY 1, 2019

div.aria-label: For aesthetics only

a.div:
CLICK HERE TO BEGIN ONLINE REGISTRATION - AVAILABLE JULY 1, 2019
If you don't have internet access, you are welcome to use a computer at the Julian Library or call the District Office at (760)765-0606 for assistance.
If you are BRAND NEW to the District, please contact the high school office between July 1 and July 22, 20129 at (760)765-0606 and we will be happy to help you with registration.

p.span: Julian Union High School District provides equal opportunity in its programs, activities, and employment. JUHSD and its employees are not responsible for the content of external links that appear on this website.

p.a: Website Hosting Solution Powered by SchoolBlocks

div.h3:
Welcome to the SchoolBlocks
self-guided tour!
div.p: The most common question we receive is, how is SchoolBlocks inspired by Pinterest? SchoolBlocks eliminates navigation bars and uses a block style layout that’s similar to Pinterest. It creates a unique and engaging browsing experience, optimizes for mobile and removes a lot of navigational complexity.
Please click on the red plus signs found on this page to learn more about specific features.
As an administrator, you will have the custom page editing tools auto-load. Just click ‘read more’ to access our advanced page editing tools.
This bar holds all content types. Click on the Admin button, click "add block", select a content type, add your content then insert the block into the page.
This icon appears when you have edit permissions. Hold your mouse down and move the block. You’ll see the page reorganize!
Each block type has a custom editing experience. Click the pencil on any block or view our help documentation to learn more about block types.
